    • Method Detail

      • init

        public static void init(android.app.Application application)
        Initializes Zingle without settings. Use this only if you intend to call init(Application, Settings, ZingleCallback) outside of an Application class

        This may only be called from Application.onCreate().

        Parameters:
        application - The Application

      • init

        public static void init(android.app.Application application,
                        Settings settings,
                        ZingleCallback<InitializationStatus> callback)
        Initialize the Zingle SDK with the provided settings.

        This may only be called from Application.onCreate(), unless init(Application) was called there.

        Use Zingle.getSettings() to retrieve and modify the given settings object.

        Parameters:
        application - The Application
        settings - The Settings to use
        callback - An optional ZingleCallback instance to be notified of the result. Call ZingleCallback.Response.getData() to check the InitializationStatus
        See Also:
        Settings, ZingleCallback, ZingleCallback.Response, InitializationStatus

      • login

        public static void login(java.lang.String userId,
                         java.lang.String jwt,
                         ZingleCallback<LoginResult> callback)
        Logs in a new Zingle user.

        You can either use this method to transition from logged out state to logged in, refresh the token of the existing logged in user or to switch the currently logged in user to a different one. You may not call login while the conversation screen is shown unless it is being called for the user already logged in. Doing so will result in a no-op. init(Application, Settings, ZingleCallback) must have been called prior to calling login.

        Parameters:
        userId - The distinct id of the user to login. Must not be null.
        jwt - jwt used to prove the origin of the login request. Must not be null.
        callback - An optional ZingleCallback instance to be notified of the result. Call ZingleCallback.Response.getData() to check the LoginResult
        See Also:
        ZingleCallback, ZingleCallback.Response, LoginResult

      • logout

        public static void logout(ZingleCallback<LogoutResult> callback)
        Logs out the current user.

        Calling this method while in anonymous state has no effect. You may not call logout while the conversation screen is shown. Doing so will result in a no-op.

        Parameters:
        callback - An optional ZingleCallback instance to be notified of the result. Call ZingleCallback.Response.getData() to check the LogoutResult
        See Also:
        ZingleCallback, ZingleCallback.Response, LogoutResult

      • startConversation

        public static void startConversation(ZingleCallback<java.lang.Void> callback)
        Force-start a conversation for the current user.

        Creates a user and conversation on the server, allowing the business to reach out proactively to the user via the public API.

        Creating a conversation via this method will count as an active user conversation (AUC) whether messages are exchanged or not, which may incur cost based on your plan. It is strongly recommended to only call this method in the case where a message is likely to be sent.

        This method is called automatically when starting a conversation via the Conversation.sendMessage(Message) or Conversation.uploadImage(Message, ZingleCallback) methods, or when a user sends a message via the conversation activity.

        If a conversation already exists for the current user, this call is a no-op.

        Parameters:
        callback - An optional ZingleCallback instance to be notified of the result.
        See Also:
        ZingleCallback, ZingleCallback.Response

      • loadConversation

        public static void loadConversation(java.lang.String conversationId,
                                    ZingleCallback<Conversation> callback)
        Loads a conversation by its ID and sets it as the active conversation for the current session.

        When called, subscribes the current device for push notifications on the passed conversationId, and sets the SDK to send and receive messages for that conversation going forward. Does not unsubscribe for notification on previously loaded conversations.

        The provided callback contain the conversation that was loaded if successful.

        If the conversation is already set to the passed id, this call will just return the currently loaded conversation.

        Parameters:
        conversationId - The conversationId to set.
        callback - An optional ZingleCallback instance to be notified of the result.
        See Also:
        ZingleCallback, ZingleCallback.Response

      • destroy

        public static void destroy()
        Terminate the Zingle facilities.

        Zingle is automatically terminated when the application exits. This method does not, usually, have to be called manually.

      • getSettings

        public static Settings getSettings()
        Accessor method for the SDK settings.

        Use this object to update settings at run time. Note: Some settings may only be configured at init time. See the Settings class reference for more information.

        Returns:
        Settings object passed in init(Application, Settings, ZingleCallback), or null if Zingle hasn't been initialized yet.
        See Also:
        Settings

      • getConversation

        public static Conversation getConversation()
        Accessor method for the current conversation.
        Returns:
        Current conversation, or null if Zingle.init() hasn't been called yet.
        See Also:
        Conversation

      • getConversationById

        public static void getConversationById(java.lang.String conversationId,
                                       ZingleCallback<Conversation> callback)
        Get a Conversation by its ID. This is an asynchronous call and requires a ZingleCallback to retrieve the result.
        Parameters:
        conversationId - the ID of the conversation to be retrieved
        callback - An instance of ZingleCallback to be notified of the result.
        See Also:
        Conversation

      • getConversationsList

        public static void getConversationsList(ZingleCallback<java.util.List<Conversation>> callback)
        Get the list of the 10 most recently active Conversations for the current user, sorted from most recently updated to last.

        Note that these conversations will only contain the most recent message for that conversation. Use getConversationById(String, ZingleCallback) to retrieve the full details of a conversation, or loadConversation(String, ZingleCallback) to make it active.

        Parameters:
        callback - An instance of ZingleCallback to be notified of the result.
        See Also:
        getConversationById(String, ZingleCallback), loadConversation(String, ZingleCallback), getConversation()

        Returns:
        Current app configuration, or null if Zingle.init() hasn't been called yet.
        See Also:
        Config

      • setFirebaseCloudMessagingToken

                                                  ZingleCallback<LoginResult> callback)
        Method used to register the Firebase Cloud Messaging token to Zingle
        Parameters:

        callback - The callback to be called when token is received by Zingle

      • setConversationDelegate

        public static void setConversationDelegate(ConversationDelegate conversationDelegate)
        Sets the ConversationDelegate

        This delegate will be notified before the delegate set using setConversationUiDelegate(ConversationDelegate)

        Any delegate functions with the form boolean return type will prevent notification of conversationUiDelegate

        See setConversationUiDelegate(ConversationDelegate)

        Parameters:
        conversationDelegate - an instance of ConversationDelegate

      • getConversationDelegate

        public static ConversationDelegate getConversationDelegate()
        Gets the delegate set via setConversationDelegate(ConversationDelegate).
        Returns:
        an instance of ConversationDelegate

      • setConversationUiDelegate

        public static void setConversationUiDelegate(ConversationDelegate conversationUiDelegate)
        Sets the ConversationDelegate used by the zingle-ui package

        The primary use of this property is to notify the Zingle UI of changes in the Conversation

        Note that this delegate will be notified after the delegate set using setConversationDelegate(ConversationDelegate)

        See setConversationDelegate(ConversationDelegate)

        Parameters:
        conversationUiDelegate - an instance of ConversationDelegate

      • getConversationUiDelegate

        public static ConversationDelegate getConversationUiDelegate()
        Gets the delegate set via setConversationUiDelegate(ConversationDelegate).
        Returns:
        an instance of ConversationDelegate for the conversation UI

      • getConversationDelegates

        public static java.util.Collection<ConversationDelegate> getConversationDelegates()
        Gets the collection of ConversationDelegate that have been set on the SDK as a SortedMap where the integrator defined delegate will appear before the delegate used to notify the Zingle UI
        Returns:
        a SortedMap of ConversationDelegate

      • setConversationViewDelegate

        public static void setConversationViewDelegate(ConversationViewDelegate conversationViewDelegate)
        Sets the ConversationViewDelegate

        The delegate allows you to be notified of events related to the conversation view

        Parameters:
        conversationViewDelegate - an instance of ConversationViewDelegate

      • getConversationViewDelegate

        Returns:
        an instance of ConversationViewDelegate

      • setMessageModifierDelegate

        public static void setMessageModifierDelegate(MessageModifierDelegate messageModifierDelegate)
        Sets the MessageModifierDelegate

        The delegate allows you to change the way messages are displayed or sent to Zingle.

        Parameters:
        messageModifierDelegate - The messageModifierDelegate

      • getMessageModifierDelegate
